mesquite.lib

Class Listened

  • java.lang.Object
    • mesquite.lib.Listened
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listenable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Attachable, CommandRecord, MesquiteFile, MesquiteString, MesquiteSymbol

    public class Listened
extends java.lang.Object
implements Listenable
    A class that notifies listeners if it changes. Superclass for Associable and MesquiteString

      • notifyListeners

        public void notifyListeners(java.lang.Object caller,
                            Notification notification,
                            java.lang.Class clss,
                            boolean classOnly)
        notifies listeners that the element, and in particular part i, has changed. The ith part may be the ith character (if element is a CharacterData), or the ith tree (if a TreeVector), etc.. Notifies only those elements of class clss if boolean is true; notifies only those elements not of class clss if boolean is false

      • doAfterNotify

        public void doAfterNotify(Notification notification)

      • notifyListeners

        public void notifyListeners(java.lang.Object caller,
                            Notification notification)
        notifies listeners that the element, and in particular part i, has changed. The ith part may be the ith character (if element is a CharacterData), or the ith tree (if a TreeVector), etc.
        Specified by:
        notifyListeners in interface Listenable

      • getRemainingListeners

        public static int getRemainingListeners()
        Returns the number of listeners remaining that are still registered with this element. Useful to see that listeners are removing themselves as needed.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Deletes the object. Should typically be called via close() to make sure that the file element is not in use etc.

      • notifyDisposing

        public void notifyDisposing(java.lang.Object doomedObject)
        Notifies all the listeners that the passed object is being disposed. Added June 02
